page.title: 01AROUND LONG MELFORD
page.content: The River Stour winds through the middle of our area. Cattle graze the river meadows. The ground rises gently away from the river up to rolling farm land. The main crops are sugar beet and corn. the large village of Long Melford (p.3,300) lies along the A 134 which follows the river valley. Long Melford has many old houses and a variety of shops including 16 antique shops and taxidermists. A disused railway line offers rough cycling, horse riding and walks in pleasan countryside. Nearby there is a picnic park with a riverside nature trail and fishing. There is a large factory outside Long Melford which processes herbs and spices for food flavouring essences. In the village there are several busy smaller factories and workshops. The countryside has a few isolated farms and hardly any houses.
